metadata.feature_description: Automatically generate and display table of contents for articles

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki article with no headings (only paragraph content)
steps.expected: TOC section should be visible and show message for no sections
steps.actual: TOC section displayed 'Contents' heading with 'No sections defined' message

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Enable TOC checkbox in article editor

steps.action: Click Edit button on Wiki article to open editor dialog
steps.expected: Editor dialog should show 'Display a Table of Contents' checkbox option
steps.actual: Editor dialog displayed with 'Display a Table of Contents:' checkbox which was checked/enabled

steps.action: Add HTML content with h2, h3, h4 headings to article (Introduction, Main Section, Subsection One, Subsection Two, Nested Details, Conclusion)
steps.expected: Content should be added with proper heading structure
steps.actual: Content with multiple heading levels (h2, h3, h4) was successfully added via HTML editor

steps.action: Publish the article and verify TOC generation
steps.expected: TOC should automatically generate from the headings in the content
steps.actual: TOC generated correctly showing all headings: Introduction, Main Section, Subsection One, Subsection Two, Nested Details, Conclusion

steps.action: Verify nested heading structure in TOC display
steps.expected: TOC should display h2 headings as top-level, h3 as nested under h2, h4 as nested under h3
steps.actual: TOC correctly displayed hierarchical nested structure: h2 (Introduction, Main Section, Conclusion) with h3 (Subsection One, Subsection Two) nested under Main Section, and h4 (Nested Details) nested under Subsection Two

observations: The TOC feature parses h2, h3, and h4 heading tags from article content (h1 is not included based on code review)
TOC is controlled per-article via 'Display a Table of Contents' checkbox in the article editor
When no headings exist in article content, TOC shows 'No sections defined' message
TOC displays as a numbered/lettered hierarchical list (1, 2, 3 for h2; i, ii for h3; a for h4)
